stories.story: As an operator, I want OpenAI capabilities (chat, responses, embeddings, images, audio, files, models, batches) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access OpenAI APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Anthropic capabilities (messages, models) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Anthropic APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Gemini capabilities (models, files, cached content, batches, tuned models, file search, corpora, generated files) available in the built-in registry with query-param auth, so agents can access Google Gemini APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want OpenRouter capabilities (chat completions, completions, responses, embeddings, models, providers, generation, credits, API keys) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access OpenRouter APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Replicate capabilities (predictions, models, deployments, trainings, files, collections) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Replicate APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want ElevenLabs capabilities (TTS, STS, voice design, voices, dubbing, audio isolation, models) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access ElevenLabs APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Deepgram capabilities (transcription, TTS, text intelligence, models, voice agent) available in the built-in registry with WebSocket support on dual hosts, so agents can access Deepgram APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Mistral capabilities (chat completions, embeddings, FIM, agents, files, fine-tuning, moderations, OCR, models) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Mistral APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Groq capabilities (chat completions, responses, audio, embeddings, files, fine-tuning, batches, models) available in the built-in registry with OpenAI-compatible paths, so agents can access Groq APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Cohere capabilities (chat, embed, rerank, classify, tokenize, models, connectors, datasets, embed-jobs, fine-tuning) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Cohere APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Perplexity capabilities (chat completions, responses, search, embeddings) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Perplexity APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Fireworks AI capabilities (chat completions, completions, embeddings, image generation, audio, rerank) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Fireworks APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Together AI capabilities (chat completions, completions, embeddings, images, rerank, models, fine-tuning, files, audio) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Together AI APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Hugging Face Inference capabilities (model inference, OpenAI-compatible chat, models) available in the built-in registry with dual-host support, so agents can access Hugging Face APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Stability AI capabilities (image generation, upscale, edit, control, video, 3D, engines) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Stability AI APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want AssemblyAI capabilities (transcript, upload, real-time streaming, LLM gateway) available in the built-in registry with multi-host support, so agents can access AssemblyAI APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Slack capabilities (chat, conversations, users, files, reactions, search, and more) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Slack Web APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Discord capabilities (channels, guilds, users, webhooks, applications) available in the built-in registry with Bot token auth, so agents can access Discord APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Twilio capabilities available in the built-in registry with HTTP Basic auth, so agents can access Twilio REST APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Notion capabilities (pages, databases, blocks, users, search, comments) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Notion APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Airtable capabilities (records, meta, webhooks) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Airtable APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Linear capabilities (GraphQL API, file storage) available in the built-in registry with dual-host support, so agents can access Linear APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want HubSpot capabilities (CRM objects, pipelines, properties, associations, marketing, CMS, conversations, automation) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access HubSpot APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Todoist capabilities (tasks, projects, sections, comments, labels, sync) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Todoist APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Intercom capabilities (contacts, conversations, messages, articles, help center, tags, tickets) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Intercom APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Calendly capabilities (scheduled events, event types, users, organizations, availability, webhooks) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Calendly APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want GitHub capabilities (repos, orgs, issues, search, GraphQL, gists, users, notifications, meta) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access GitHub APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Resend capabilities (emails, contacts, broadcasts, domains) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Resend APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want SendGrid capabilities (mail send, marketing, templates, stats, suppressions) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access SendGrid APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Postmark capabilities (email, bounces, templates, stats, message streams) available in the built-in registry with custom header auth, so agents can access Postmark APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Mailgun capabilities (sending, domains, routes, lists) available in the built-in registry with Basic auth, so agents can access Mailgun APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Stripe capabilities (payments, customers, billing, disputes) available in the built-in registry as GET-only for analytics, so agents can read Stripe data with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Shopify capabilities (admin REST and GraphQL API) available in the built-in registry with custom header auth, so agents can access Shopify APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Square capabilities (payments, orders, catalog, customers, inventory, invoices, locations) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Square APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want QuickBooks capabilities (accounting API for invoices, customers, payments, bills, vendors, items) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access QuickBooks APIs with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want Xero capabilities (accounting API for invoices, contacts, bank transactions, accounts, payments, reports) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Xero APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want X capabilities (tweets, users, lists, spaces, DMs) available in the built-in registry with app-only Bearer auth, so agents can access X API v2 with zero policy authoring.

As an operator, I want YouTube Data capabilities (videos, search, channels, playlists, comments, subscriptions, captions) available in the built-in registry with query-param auth, so agents can access YouTube Data API v3 with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Spotify capabilities (catalog, playlists, me/player, users) available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Spotify Web API with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Telegram Bot API capabilities available in the built-in registry, so agents can access Telegram messaging APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Reddit capabilities (API operations, content browsing) available in the built-in registry with OAuth Bearer auth, so agents can access Reddit APIs with zero policy authoring.
As an operator, I want Mailchimp available in the built-in registry, so campaigns and audience APIs can be proxied with near-zero policy authoring.
stories.gapReason: Requires per-tenant host binding ({dc}.api.mailchimp.com); registry JSON does not exist yet.

stories.story: As an operator, I want Datadog available in the built-in registry, so monitoring APIs can be proxied with near-zero policy authoring.
stories.gapReason: Datadog requires two keys in different headers; multi-field secrets and multi-header injection are not implemented.

stories.story: As an operator, I want Algolia available in the built-in registry, so search APIs can be proxied with near-zero policy authoring.
stories.gapReason: Requires multiple header secrets (app id + api key); multi-header injection not implemented.

knownCoverageGaps.description: Registry JSON files are compiled in and schema-validated, but per-provider e2e tests only exist for OpenAI. Other providers rely on the builtin_registry() load test which validates all JSONs parse and load, but does not assert per-provider capability shapes.

Shopify registry uses static host 'myshopify.com' but actual requests target store-specific subdomains ({store}.myshopify.com). Per-tenant host binding or wildcard host matching is needed for production use.
Telegram registry uses Bearer auth as a placeholder. Telegram Bot API actually embeds the token in the URL path (/bot{token}/methodName). A new token-in-path auth strategy is needed.
QuickBooks and Xero registries use Bearer auth (pre-obtained OAuth2 access token). The vault does not yet handle OAuth2 token exchange or refresh; users must provide a valid access token directly.
Spotify registry uses Bearer auth (pre-obtained OAuth2 access token). The vault does not yet handle OAuth2 client credentials flow; users must provide a valid access token directly.
